start.heroDescription: In just 1 minute, we'll analyze your personality type and match you with compatible university labels (Ivy League, Oxbridge, etc.). Answer honestly!

result.traitDescription: We analyzed the 4 key axes that shape your decisions and behavioral patterns.

questions.MP1: I tend to feel satisfied when I have an 'aha!' moment, more than by high scores.
questions.MP14: Even with a high score, I often feel uneasy if I can't explain why I got it right.
questions.MP4: My motivation surges when my ranking or test scores improve.
questions.MP6: When studying, I tend to care about whether I look competent to others.
questions.MP19: I tend to prioritize 'getting points' over deep understanding.
questions.MP21: The night before a test, I'm the type to tackle topics I still don't understand.
questions.AS3: When I think 'the payoff could be huge,' I tend to act quickly.
questions.AS15: I tend to choose options with high potential, even if they're not guaranteed.
questions.AS4: When I see 'this could go badly,' I tend to become cautious.
questions.AS14: Before submitting, I tend to double-check for mistakes.
questions.AS19: I feel 'playing it safe' suits me better than taking risks.
questions.AS21: In practice tests, I tend to tackle hard problems to boost my score.
questions.CU1: The harder the topic, the more I tend to think until it truly makes sense.
questions.CU2: I tend to understand better when I rephrase terms and rules in my own words.
questions.CU3: I tend to make things 'usable' first, before fully understanding the theory.
questions.CU6: I tend to learn by doing, adding insights as I go.
questions.CU19: I tend to think it's OK if I can solve/make something work, even if I can't explain it.
questions.CU21: For new topics, I'm the type to first establish definitions and the big picture.
questions.IN1: I tend to perform better when I have quiet, solo time to focus.
questions.IN3: I tend to organize my thoughts before speaking to others.
questions.IN2: Interacting with people or being in a social setting tends to recharge me.
questions.IN14: I tend to reach conclusions faster when I think out loud with others.
questions.IN19: I tend to organize my thoughts better by just starting to talk, even if unpolished.
questions.IN21: On the first day of a new class, I tend to observe the atmosphere before approaching people.

about.title: About UniType16
about.intro: UniType16 is a self-check tool that organizes and verbalizes your tendencies in 'how you learn, decide, and work with others' across 4 axes. Rather than a typical 'personality test,' it's designed to summarize your daily behavioral style into a conversational format.
about.axis1desc: Do you prioritize deep understanding and growth (Mastery), or results, evaluation, and winning strategies (Performance)?
about.axis2desc: Do you prioritize challenges and gains (Advance), or safety and avoiding failure (Secure)?
about.axis3desc: Do you prefer digging into principles and concepts (Cognition), or practical shortcuts (Utility)?
about.axis4desc: Do you progress by self-organizing (Internal), or by leveraging your environment and people (Network)?
about.howToReadDesc: Results are not about 'better or worse' but a snapshot of tendencies that emerge in certain situations. Use the 4-letter code not as a label that defines you, but as shorthand for understanding your strengths and potential stumbling points.
about.disclaimerDesc: UniType16 is not a psychological assessment intended for medical/clinical diagnosis or high-stakes decisions like hiring. Please use it as a tool for self-understanding and communication.

cookie.title: Cookie Usage
cookie.description: This site uses cookies to improve our services. By clicking 'Accept', you agree to the following uses:
cookie.analytics: Analytics: Understanding site usage to improve experience
cookie.ads: Ad Optimization: Showing ads based on your interests
